page.description: Resets the starting position of the current cell to the top-left of the previous cell.

section.title: Discussion
section.description: When using the {CONDITION} command, the space that would have been taken up by controls that are conditionally displayed is taken up even if the controls are not displayed. In certain circumstances, you may want to replace one set of controls with another set of controls, depending on the value of a conditional expression. The {start_pos} command is used with the 2nd through Nth {condition} statement to reset the starting position of the current cell to the top-left of the previous cell.
section.note: IMPORTANT : Notice in the above sample code structure that the {endregion} for each conditional control is not terminated with a line break command ( ';' ), A line break is only used after the last conditional control

section.title: Example

This script produces this dialog when the condition, payby=2, is TRUE.
